contentrichtext.text: {{primary sources|date=April 2008}} {{Infobox University |name = Institute of Technology, Tallaght |native_name = Institiúid Teicneolaíochta, Tamhlacht |image = [[Image:Ittdublin.png]] |established = 1992 |type = [[Institutes of Technology in Ireland|Institute of Technology]] |head_label = President |head = Pat McLaughlin |students = 3,700 (2,600 full time) |staff = 400 |campus = {{convert|45|acre|m2}} |city = [[Tallaght]] |country = [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] |website = http://www.ittdublin.ie/ |address = ITT Dublin<br/>Tallaght<br/>Dublin 24 |telephone = +353 1 404 2000 }} '''Institute of Technology, Tallaght''' ('''ITT''') formerly '''Regional Technical College, Tallaght''', located in [[Tallaght]], [[South Dublin]] in [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]. ==History== The institute was established in 1992, at that time the final new [[Institutes of Technology in Ireland|Regional Technical College]] opened in Ireland. In 2005 the institute adopted the abbreviated title of '''ITT Dublin''', to differentiate it from IT Tralee; this does not change the legal name which continues to be "Institute of Technology, Tallaght" as confirmed in the Institutes of Technology Act, 2006. ==Faculties and Courses== The institute offers a variety of courses,<ref name="ittcourses">{{cite web |accessdate = 2011-06-24 | publisher = [[Institute of Technology Tallaght]] | url = http://www.it-tallaght.ie/FullTimeCourses/CompleteCourseList/ | title = Institute of Technology, Tallaght : Complete Course List }}</ref> including [[Higher Certificate]]s and [[Bachelors Degree]]s as well as [[Postgraduate courses]] in the schools of [[accountancy]], [[business]], [[computing]], [[engineering]], [[humanities]] and [[science]] Please note that graduates of TA321 (Pharmaceutical Science - NFQ Level 8) or TA314 (Pharmaceutical Science - NFQ Level 7) do not qualify to register with the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland as practicing pharmacists. Only graduates from the approved NFQ Level 8 Pharmacy courses of RC005 (The Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland), TR072 (Trinity College, Dublin) and CK703 (University College, Cork) may successfully apply for membership with the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland. ==Student life== The college has many societies such as a drama society and a radio society. It has many successful sports teams.<ref>http://www.it-tallaght.ie/publications/Sports.pdf</ref> ITT is in the process of redeveloping land donated by Saint Mary's Priory for use as sports pitches. The Club's and Societies in IT Tallaght are numerous and perform well in intervarsity events. Societies include Drama, Radio, Soccer, Martial Arts and Computing. In October 2012 a Cricket Club was set up in the Institute. The club has established to be one of the most active club in the Institute and will be taking in the upcoming Indoor Cricket intervarsities in Galway. ==Technical== The institute is the [[network hub|hub]] of the [[ITnet]] [[computer network|network]]. ==See also== * [[Education in the Republic of Ireland]] * [[List of higher education institutions in the Republic of Ireland]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.ittdublin.ie/ Official site] {{Institutes of Technology in Ireland}} {{coord|53.290523|N|6.363564|W|type:landmark_region:IE|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Institute Of Technology, Tallaght}} [[Category:Tallaght]] [[Category:Universities and colleges in the Republic of Ireland|Tallaght]] [[Category:Education in South Dublin (county)]]
